header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 92/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000371­2019) Keshav Jadhav Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application by Keshav Narayan Jadhav for Ad­ interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.500/2018 registered under Sections 306, 323, 504 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Warje­ Malwadi, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 306, 323, 504 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Ravindra Choudhary alleged that, present Applicant married with his sister, namely, Sandhya in the year 2008. But after marriage, Applicant ill­treated her for demand of money, for purchase of Flat. Applicant used to ill­treat her as she could not conceive. Applicant performed another marriage and begot one daughter and one son out of the relations. Therefore, his sister victim Sandhya was under stress and ultimately on 24/12/2018 she committed suicide by hanging herself. Therefore, he lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Ravindra Choudhary alleged that, present Applicant married with his sister, namely, Sandhya in the year 2008.
But after marriage, Applicant ill­treated her for demand of money, for purchase of Flat.
Applicant used to ill­treat her as she could not conceive.
Applicant performed another marriage and begot one daughter and one son out of the relations.
Therefore, his sister victim Sandhya was under stress and ultimately on 24/12/2018 she committed suicide by hanging herself.
Therefore, he lodged the report.

arguments.text: 3] Applicant submits that, he never ill­treated victim Sandhya. In fact, marriage had taken place in the year 2004. He annexed documents to show his service record as well as financial condition of victim Sandhya. He submits that, Sandhya preferred proceedings for maintenance and it was amicably settled. He transferred some portion of land in the name of Sandhya. Therefore, absolutely there was no abettment to Sandhya to commit suicide. He is reputed person and not going to flee away from course of justice. Hence, he prays for grant of interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicant submits that, he never ill­treated victim Sandhya.
In fact, marriage had taken place in the year 2004.
He annexed documents to show his service record as well as financial condition of victim Sandhya.
He submits that, Sandhya preferred proceedings for maintenance and it was amicably settled.
He transferred some portion of land in the name of Sandhya.
Therefore, absolutely there was no abettment to Sandhya to commit suicide.
He is reputed person and not going to flee away from course of justice.
Hence, he prays for grant of interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] Heard Adv. V. R. Raut for Applicant. Perused the papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard Adv. V. R. Raut for Applicant.
Perused the papers.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicant is about ill­ treatment to victim and thereby abetting her to commit suicide. Prima facie, the marriage with Applicant had taken place in the year 2004. Meanwhile, maintenance issue was also resolved amicably. In such scenario, it would be question of final adjudication whether Applicant abetted victim to commit suicide. But, no immediate recovery is shown. Therefore, immediate custody of the Applicant is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass the following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicant is about ill­ treatment to victim and thereby abetting her to commit suicide.
Prima facie, the marriage with Applicant had taken place in the year 2004.
Meanwhile, maintenance issue was also resolved amicably.
In such scenario, it would be question of final adjudication whether Applicant abetted victim to commit suicide.
But, no immediate recovery is shown.
Therefore, immediate custody of the Applicant is not necessary.
Hence, I prefer to pass the following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 500/2018 registered under Sections 306, 323, 504 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Warje­Malwadi, Pune Applicant Keshav Narayan Jadhav be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make himself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 92/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000371­2019) Keshav Jadhav Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application by Keshav Narayan Jadhav for Ad­ interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.500/2018 registered under Sections 306, 323, 504 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Warje­ Malwadi, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Ravindra Choudhary alleged that, present Applicant married with his sister, namely, Sandhya in the year 2008. But after marriage, Applicant ill­treated her for demand of money, for purchase of Flat. Applicant used to ill­treat her as she could not conceive. Applicant performed another marriage and begot one daughter and one son out of the relations. Therefore, his sister victim Sandhya was under stress and ultimately on 24/12/2018 she committed suicide by hanging herself. Therefore, he lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicant submits that, he never ill­treated victim Sandhya. In fact, marriage had taken place in the year 2004. He annexed documents to show his service record as well as financial condition of victim Sandhya. He submits that, Sandhya preferred proceedings for maintenance and it was amicably settled. He transferred some portion of land in the name of Sandhya. Therefore, absolutely there was no abettment to Sandhya to commit suicide. He is reputed person and not going to flee away from course of justice. Hence, he prays for grant of interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard Adv. V. R. Raut for Applicant. Perused the papers.
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicant is about ill­ treatment to victim and thereby abetting her to commit suicide. Prima facie, the marriage with Applicant had taken place in the year 2004. Meanwhile, maintenance issue was also resolved amicably. In such scenario, it would be question of final adjudication whether Applicant abetted victim to commit suicide. But, no immediate recovery is shown. Therefore, immediate custody of the Applicant is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass the following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 500/2018 registered under Sections 306, 323, 504 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Warje­Malwadi, Pune Applicant Keshav Narayan Jadhav be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make himself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
sd/­xxx Pune. (Smt. A. V. Rotte) Date : 11/01/2019. Additional Sessions Judge,Pune  C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P. D. F. file Order are same word for word as per original Order. Name of the Court :­ Smt. A. V. Rotte, District Judge – 7 and Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Name of the Steno :­ Shri. D. L. Gudde, Stenographer (Grade­II) Date of Order :­ 11/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer :­ 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on :­ 11/01/2019.
